Legal_Issue: Can Musadiq Pardhan be penalized for contempt of court, and what is the appropriate fine?
Governing_Law: Rule 355(2) of the Federal Court Rules
Procedural_Stage: Contempt proceedings following breach of interlocutory injunction
Evidence_Assessment: 39 shipments exported in breach; single show cause order; plaintiffs' evidence considered
Decision_Outcome: Musadiq Pardhan found guilty of contempt; fined $4,000; Mustafa Pardhan not guilty
Burden_of_Proof: On the plaintiffs to prove breach of injunction
Credibility_Factor: Court assessed credibility of parties based on evidence presented
Legal_Rule: Contempt of court carries a maximum fine of $5,000 or imprisonment up to one year under Rule 355(2)
Standard_of_Review: Objective assessment of compliance with court order
Procedural_Issue: Assessment of penalty within statutory limits and procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Breach of interlocutory injunction prohibiting export of Coca-Cola products
Outcome_on_Merits: Guilty verdict against Musadiq Pardhan; dismissal of claim against Mustafa Pardhan
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and proportionality of penalty
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Hearing conducted with opportunity to respond via show cause order
Key_Evidence_Considered: Number of shipments (39); nature of export activity; dismissal of original injunction
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs sought $105,300 fine, exceeding statutory limit
Court_Result: Fine of $4,000 imposed on Musadiq Pardhan; costs awarded: $80,000 against Musadiq, $15,000 against Mustafa
Standard_of_Proof: Clear and convincing evidence of intentional breach
Defendant_Response: Implied non-compliance despite injunction; no successful defense raised
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of shipments, court orders, legal submissions
Outcome: Fine reduced to $4,000 due to statutory cap and mitigating factors
Remedy_Sought: Monetary penalty for contempt, cost awards
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination following show cause hearing
Legal_Provision_Cited: Rule 355(2) of the Federal Court Rules
Governing_Rule: Rule 355(2) of the Federal Court Rules
